unnormalised: Delhi Jal Board data shows water consumption spiked during the heatwave. Households in South Delhi averaged 2000 liters per day in May, a jump of almost 25% compared to April's 1600 liters. Experts are blaming leaky pipes & ppl watering their gardens excessively.
normalised: Delhi Jal Board data shows water consumption spiked during the heatwave. Households in South Delhi averaged two thousand liters per day in May, a jump of almost twenty five percent compared to April's one thousand six hundred liters. Experts are blaming leaky pipes and people watering their gardens excessively.

unnormalised: Power consumption also hit a record high. BSES reported peak demand of 4500 MW, straining the city's grid. Lots of folks cranked up their ACs, using upwards of 10 units a day, leading to some hefty electricity bills, I tell you!
normalised: Power consumption also hit a record high. B-S-E-S reported peak demand of four thousand five hundred mega watt, straining the city's grid. Lots of folks cranked up their A-C-s, using upwards of ten units a day, leading to some hefty electricity bills, I tell you!

unnormalised: "Bijli ka bill toh fat hi gaya, bhai!" says Rakesh from Lajpat Nagar. His bill jumped from Rs. 3500 to Rs. 5000 in a single month. Officials are urging residents to use water and electricity judiciously to avoid future shortages and even bigger bills.
normalised: "Bijli ka bill toh fat hi gaya, bhai!" says Rakesh from Lajpat Nagar. His bill jumped from rupees three thousand five hundred to rupees five thousand in a single month. Officials are urging residents to use water and electricity judiciously to avoid future shortages and even bigger bills.
